Question
========

Suppose that in a population d is normally distributed with mean 63 and standard deviation 14. We draw from this population a sample of size n = 5. Then for the sample mean

Answerlist
----------

* Mean ~ N(μ = 12.6, σ = 2.8)
* Mean ~ N(μ = 63, σ = 2.8)
* Mean ~ N(μ = 63, σ = 6.26)
* Mean ~ N(μ = 12.6, σ = 39.2)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Mean ~ N(μ = 12.6, σ = 2.8): Incorrect
* Mean ~ N(μ = 63, σ = 2.8): Incorrect
* Mean ~ N(μ = 63, σ = 6.26): Correct
* Mean ~ N(μ = 12.6, σ = 39.2): Incorrect
